item.name: avgBusy1
item.description: 1 minute exponentially-decayed moving average of the CPU busy percentage.

item.name: ciscoEnvMonFanState
item.description: The current state of the fan being instrumented. 1:normal 2:warning 3:critical 4:shutdown 5:notPresent 6:notFunctioning

item.name: ciscoEnvMonSupplyState
item.description: The current state of the power supply being instrumented. 1:normal 2:warning 3:critical 4:shutdown 5:notPresent 6:notFunctioning

item.name: ciscoEnvMonTemperatureState
item.description: The current state of the testpoint being instrumented. 1:normal 2:warning 3:critical 4:shutdown 5:notPresent 6:notFunctioning

item.name: ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusValue
item.description: The current measurement of the testpoint being instrumented [degrees Celsius].

item.name: ciscoMemoryPoolFree
item.description:
Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device.
Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed and ciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memory in the pool.

item.name: ciscoMemoryPoolUsed
item.description: Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device.

item.name: dot1dStpDesignatedRoot
item.description: The bridge identifier of the root of the spanning tree as determined by the Spanning Tree Protocol as executed by this node. This value is used as the Root Identifier parameter in all Configuration Bridge PDUs originated by this node.

item.name: dot1dStpPriority
item.description: The value of the write-able portion of the Bridge ID, i.e., the first two octets of the (8 octet long) Bridge ID. The other (last) 6 octets of the Bridge ID are given by the value of dot1dBaseBridgeAddress.

item.name: dot1dStpRootCost
item.description: The cost of the path to the root as seen from this bridge.

item.name: dot1dStpRootPort
item.description: The port number of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this bridge to the root bridge.

item.name: dot1dStpTimeSinceTopologyChange
item.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the last time a topology change was detected by the bridge entity.

item.name: dot1dStpTopChanges
item.description: The total number of topology changes detected by this bridge since the management entity was last reset or initialized.

item.name: entPhysicalModelName
item.description: The vendor-specific model name identifier string associated with this physical component. The preferred value is the customer-visible part number, which may be printed on the component itself.

item.name: entPhysicalSoftwareRev
item.description: The vendor-specific software revision string for the physical entity.

discovery_rule.name: Interfaces
discovery_rule.description: Creates two Macros: - {#SNMPINDEX} takes its value from the part of the OID that is after ifDescr (SNMP OID) - {#SNMPVALUE} takes value of interface's name

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPort.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The port number of the port for which this entry contains Spanning Tree Protocol management information.

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortDesignatedBridge.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The Bridge Identifier of the bridge which this port considers to be the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortDesignatedCost.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The path cost of the Designated Port of the segment connected to this port. This value is compared to the Root Path Cost field in received bridge PDUs.

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortDesignatedPort.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The Port Identifier of the port on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortDesignatedRoot.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The unique Bridge Identifier of the Bridge recorded as the Root in the Configuration BPDUs transmitted by the Designated Bridge for the segment to which the port is attached.

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortEnable.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The enabled/disabled status of the port. 1 - enabled 2 - disabled

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortPriority.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The value of the priority field which is contained in the first (in network byte order) octet of the (2 octet long) Port ID. The other octet of the Port ID is given by the value of dot1dStpPort.

item_prototype.name: dot1dStpPortState.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The port's current state as defined by application of the Spanning Tree Protocol. This state controls what action a port takes on reception of a frame. If the bridge has detected a port that is malfunctioning it will place that port into the broken(6) state. For ports which are disabled (see dot1dStpPortEnable), this object will have a value of disabled(1).

item_prototype.name: dot3StatsAlignmentErrors.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
A count of frames received on a particular interface that are not an integral number of octets in length and do not pass the FCS check.
The count represented by an instance of this object is incremented when the alignmentError status is returned by the MAC service to the LLC (or other MAC user). Received frames for which multiple error conditions pertain are, according to the conventions of IEEE 802.3 Layer Management, counted exclusively according to the error status presented to the LLC.
This counter does not increment for group encoding schemes greater than 4 bits per group.

item_prototype.name: dot3StatsFCSErrors.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
A count of frames received on a particular interface that are an integral number of octets in length but do not pass the FCS check. This count does not include frames received with frame-too-long or frame-too-short error.
The count represented by an instance of this object is incremented when the frameCheckError status is returned by the MAC service to the LLC (or other MAC user). Received frames for which multiple error conditions pertain are, according to the conventions of IEEE 802.3 Layer Management, counted exclusively according to the error status presented to the LLC.
Note: Coding errors detected by the physical layer for speeds above 10 Mb/s will cause the frame to fail the FCS check.

item_prototype.name: dot3StatsMultipleCollisionFrames.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
A count of frames that are involved in more than one collision and are subsequently transmitted successfully.
A frame that is counted by an instance of this object is also counted by the corresponding instance of either the ifOutUcastPkts, ifOutMulticastPkts, or ifOutBroadcastPkts, and is not counted by the corresponding instance of the dot3StatsSingleCollisionFrames object.
This counter does not increment when the interface is operating in full-duplex mode.

item_prototype.name: dot3StatsSingleCollisionFrames.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
A count of frames that are involved in a single collision, and are subsequently transmitted successfully.
A frame that is counted by an instance of this object is also counted by the corresponding instance of either the ifOutUcastPkts, ifOutMulticastPkts, or ifOutBroadcastPkts, and is not counted by the corresponding instance of the dot3StatsMultipleCollisionFrames object.
This counter does not increment when the interface is operating in full-duplex mode.

item_prototype.name: ifInDiscards.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. - INPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval linked to trigger

item_prototype.name: ifInErrors.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: number of Interface errors - INPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval linked to trigger

item_prototype.name: ifInNUcastPkts.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer. - INPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval

item_prototype.name: ifInOctets.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: "The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters - converted to Interface speed in [B] value: change from last information retrieval

item_prototype.name: ifInUcastPkts.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer - INPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval

item_prototype.name: ifInUnknownProtos.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
The number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol - INPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval
Linked to trigger

item_prototype.name: ifLastChange.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time the interface entered its current operational state. If the current state was entered prior to the last re-initialization of the local network management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value. To help precisely define time of the Interface's last operation state change

item_prototype.name: ifOperStatus.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
Interface operational status: 1-up 2-down Linked to trigger (operational status change)
The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2). If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic; it should change to dormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection); it should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state; it should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing (typically, hardware) components.

item_prototype.name: ifOutDiscards.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. - OUTPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval linked to trigger

item_prototype.name: ifOutErrors.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
The number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.
- OUTPUT direction
value: change from last information retrieval
linked to trigger

item_prototype.name: ifOutNUcastPkts.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: "The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. - OUTPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval

item_prototype.name: ifOutOctets.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: "The total number of octets transmitted OUT of the interface, including framing characters. - converted to Interface speed in [B] value: change from last information retrieval

item_prototype.name: ifOutQLen.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The length of the output packet queue (in packets).

item_prototype.name: ifOutUcastPkts.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. OUTPUT direction value: change from last information retrieval

item_prototype.name: ifPromiscuousMode.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
This object has a value of false(2) if this interface only accepts packets/frames that are addressed to this station. This object has a value of true(1) when the station accepts all packets/frames transmitted on the media. The value true(1) is only legal on certain types of media. If legal, setting this object to a value of true(1) may require the interface to be reset before becoming effective.
The value of ifPromiscuousMode does not affect the reception of broadcast and multicast packets/frames by the interface

item_prototype.name: ifSpeed.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
Interface speed: 10Mbit/100Mbit/1000Mbit.... Linked to trigger (speed change)
An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second (converted to Mbits). For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth.

item_prototype.name: ifStackStatus.{#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The status of the relationship between two sub-layers. 1:active 2:notInService 3:notReady 4:createAndGo 5:createAndWait 6:destroy

trigger_prototype.name: {HOST.NAME} Interface Input Errors
{HOST.NAME} Interface Output Errors
{HOST.NAME} Packet discarded because of unknown protocol
